intro: Fimbristylis hypsocolea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedges, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. This plant typically grows in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Fimbristylis hypsocolea is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
